creator: wchao@yahoo.com
text:
Ant has a problem parsing '--' in comments:
/xxx/build.xml:171: Next character must be ">" terminating comment .

I have the following section in my build.xml:

  <target name="publish-source" depends="publish-source-verify-dir, publish-
source-fail-if-no-dir, dist" description="Publish source code to web site">
    <!--
    <exec executable="ssh">
      <arg line="${publish.server} rm -fr ${publish.dir}/*"/>
    </exec>
    <exec executable="scp">
      <arg line="${dist.dir}/src.tgz ${publish.server}:${publish.dir}"/>
    </exec>
    <exec executable="ssh">
      <arg line="${publish.server} tar --directory ${publish.dir} -x -z -f 
${publish.dir}/src.tgz"/>
    </exec>
    <exec executable="ssh">
      <arg line="${publish.server} rm -f ${publish.dir}/src.tgz"/>
    </exec>
    -->
  </target>

It is a parser issue. Ant has nothing to do with this and the parser is 
conformant with the specifications:

http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/REC-xml-20001006#sec-comments
[...]
For compatibility, the string "--" (double-hyphen) must not occur within 
comments.
